args:
Tradition is oft at odds with efficiency, but the
teachings of the past are worth protecting even
if the cost is forgoing modern convenience.
Impressed by Isaac's resolve, Sarisse and Luca
agree to help defend Yggdrasil from fiends.
Well, YEAH! This place is just fascinating!\nI'm learning so much about sylvans here.
Outfit alert! Check it out—my new friend\nfrom the village made it for me!
She said it's traditional sylvan clothing.\nPretty fierce, right?!
Try exhaustion, for starters?\nHow are you NOT dead tired?
They dragged us out of bed before dawn\nfor some ritual. The sun comes up and it's\nanother ritual. Off to a hunt next? Ritual!
How many times a day do these people\nneed to pray? I'm sure their big tree-god-\ndragon thing is tired of hearing it by now!
Or maybe that just means that compared\nto the old days, we've forgotten how to\npractice daily gratitude.
Sure, some things here are a little\ninconvenient, but I think that's part\nof what makes it all so interesting.
Luca. Sarisse. Would you mind helping us\nprepare the food?
FINALLY we get some grub! So, what do\nyou need me to do? Get a fire going?
Fire is forbidden within the wood.\nIt is law.
No fire? Doesn't that make it kinda hard to,\nI dunno, cook your food?
Those laws and customs and stuff\nwere made up by people a long time\nago, right?
I say you forget that bit and change with\nthe times. What's the point in sticking\nto the old ways that just mean suffering?
Laws and traditions are not born out of\nnothing.
The prohibition against fire arose from the\nashes of a terrible blaze that scarred this\nland.
The laws and traditions we pass down are\nborne of the lived experience of those who\ncame before us.
Fire is a useful tool. The world beyond our\nforest holds many useful tools. We here in\nInitio are not ignorant of their existence.
But we choose to protect that which has\nbeen passed down beneath our boughs,\ndespite the cost of that convenience.
We believe the history of this place\nholds value enough to make that trade\nworthwhile.
I, uh... Sorry. I guess that was kind\nof an overstep.
It's fine. You two are still in the middle of\nlearning all of this.
Always feel free to ask questions about\nthat which you do not understand. Now,\nlet's be off.
Isaac's pretty amazing.\nHonestly, EVERYONE living here is.
I've gotta agree. They give off this vibe...\nResolve, I guess? Commitment to the old\nways.
It's wild how differently they view the\nworld, even from other sylvans like us.
I'm afraid so. Some of my fellow\nguardsmen have been attacked by fiends.
They will be unable to perform their duties\nfor some time, yet we have no one here\nwho can replace them.
Not many of Initio's people are equipped\nto fight against fiends, even under the best\nof circumstances.
Psh, is that all? Just leave it to me and\nSarisse, then!
To you? Your offer is appreciated, but you\nare not technically natives of Initio...
That another old law? Seems like it'd be a\nlot worse if Yggdrasil or the village were\nattacked because you're short-staffed.
Perhaps we could ask the elder, Isaac.
True. If the elder allows it,\nI would welcome your help.
Sweet. Go hash it out with him so we can\nget this show on the road!
Yeaaah, I think I'm just not built for\nthese old rules and traditions.
I get why protecting them is important,\nthough.
You and I are cut from a different cloth,\nIsaac. Mad respect.
Anyway, we just need to pound any fiends\ngoing after Yggdrasil flat, right?
Please. But know that the fiends of this\nforest are quite fierce. Stay on your guard.
Speak of the devils! You ready, Sarisse?
Duh! Time to show our new friends the\nvery best of my repertoire!
I'll blow a hole through the whole\npack in a single shot!
